newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan May bad-cheque ratio falls to 0.51 pct.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan May bad-cheque ratio falls to 0.51 pct.

text.p: Taiwan's bad-cheque ratio fell to 0.51 percent at T$14.65 billion in May, from 0.55 percent in April, the central bank said on Saturday.
The number of bad cheques accounted for 0.51 percent of the total cheques written in May, with a value representing 0.32 percent of the value of all cheques issued, the bank said.
The monthly bad-cheque ratio was the lowest since July 1994.
The bank attributed the decline in the number of bad cheques to gradual economic recovery and improvement of manufacturers' credit standing.
Bank officials said they expected the ratio to ease further due to an improvement in the economic conditions on the island.

The cabinet-level Council for Economic Planning and Development announced on Friday 0.4 percent growth in May of Taiwan's leading business indicators, which forecast peaks and troughs in the business cycle.
Council reseachers concur that Taiwan's economy is enjoying a modest recovery, spurred by improving export orders and healthy domestic consumption.
